qas.question: Most of the early extant evidence for the origins of Mhayana comes from what type of translations?
The Mahayana teachings were first propagated into China by who?
The earliest Mahayana sutras included the very first versions of what series?
Texts concerning Aksobhya Buddha were probably composed in what century BCE?

context: Much of the early extant evidence for the origins of Mahāyāna comes from early <a0_0>Chinese<a0_0/> translations of Mahāyāna texts. These Mahāyāna teachings were first propagated into China by <a1_0>Lokakṣema<a1_0/>, the first translator of Mahāyāna sūtras into Chinese during the 2nd century CE.[note 39] Some scholars have traditionally considered the earliest Mahāyāna sūtras to include the very first versions of the <a2_0>Prajñāpāramitā<a2_0/> series, along with texts concerning Akṣobhya Buddha, which were probably composed in the <a3_0>1st<a3_0/> century BCE in the south of India.[note 40]
